summary: This is a psychology services memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York summarizing all psychological contacts with inmate Jeffrey Epstein from his arrival on July 8, 2019, through August 8, 2019. It details his placement on and removal from suicide watch, his reported incidents (including a neck injury), and his repeated denials of suicidal ideation while housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Epstein's Intake and Initial Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and was seen for an intake screening. The Chief Psychologist consulted with Central Office, and it was determined he should be placed on suicide watch due to increased risk factors.

events.title: First Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Epstein was seen for a suicide risk assessment where he denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan. He was removed from suicide watch and placed on psychology observation.

events.title: Neck Injury Incident and Suicide Watch
events.description: At approximately 2am, the Operations Lieutenant contacted the on-call psychologist to report Epstein was being placed on suicide watch as he was found with a string hanging around his neck. According to a log book, Epstein told staff his cellmate tried to kill him.

events.title: Removal from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch and placed on psychology observation. It was observed he had a scabbing scar around his neck. He continued to insist he did not know what happened.

events.title: Court Note on Suicidal Tendencies
events.description: Epstein returned from court with a note from the court indicating 'suicidal tendencies.' He was seen for another suicide risk assessment where he again denied being suicidal.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found with a string around his neck, leading to his placement on suicide watch. He later told staff his cellmate tried to kill him.
Epstein repeatedly denied any suicidal ideation, intention, or plan during multiple psychological assessments from July 9 through August 8, 2019.
A note from the court on August 1, 2019, indicated Epstein had 'suicidal tendencies,' but a subsequent risk assessment concluded his protective factors outweighed his risk factors.
Epstein expressed a preference to be housed in general population rather than the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and complained about noise and other conditions in SHU.

The memo documents a pattern of Epstein reporting correctional or administrative issues (e.g., needing a spoon, phone call access, orange jumpsuit) rather than psychological concerns during his meetings.
